meanings.definition: An exact copy or reproduction of a document
meanings.sent1: The facsimiled document looked just like the original.
meanings.sent2: I needed a facsimiled copy of the contract for my records.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a facsimiled map that led to buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her drawing was a facsimiled version of the famous painting.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a facsimiled manuscript from ancient times.

meanings.definition: To make an exact copy or reproduction of a document
meanings.sent1: She facsimiled the important letter for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The secretary facsimiled the report for distribution.
meanings.sent3: The robot facsimiled the blueprint with precision.
meanings.sent4: He facsimiled the old photograph to preserve it for future generations.
meanings.sent5: The artist facsimiled the masterpiece to practice his skills.
